content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do this using the `Dates` package to work with DateTimes. Note that the `add_yearmonth` function is modifying the input DataFrame in-place because it's more efficient than creating a new column and copying all the other data.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth!(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Dates.year(dt)*100 + Dates.month(dt) for dt in df[:dt]]
end
```
You can call this function on your DataFrame as follows:
```julia
add_yearmonth!(df)
```
